programme.title: Princess Margaret: The Rebel Royal
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary profile of the Queen's sister, whose life and loves reflected the social and sexual revolution that transformed Britain during the 20th century. With archive footage and interviews, the series follows Margaret's life as she redefined the image of the modern princess, and begins with her birth in 1930. The abdication of her uncle propelled Margaret to second in line to the throne, but her life would be shaped by dramatic social change as Britain entered a more egalitarian era after the Second World War.

programme.title: Railway Murders
programme.desc: In May 1957 an elderly Polish Countess was travelling home from a party when she was attacked at Gloucester Road Tube station.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: A Sea King rescue helicopter requires a new engine installing, as well as giant rotor blades and a 1970s computer system reviving, before it can return to the skies.

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the Co Meath town of Enfield to the east coast port of Drogheda in Co Louth. He explores the railway network within the Bog of Allen, learns about the Victorian secrets of the Boyne Viaduct, and ventures into underground zinc mines.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Victorians' fascination with antiquity as he continues his tour of the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland. He visits the cromlech stones of Dundalk, Co Louth, and an observatory in Co Armagh, and travels on the steam railway in Downpatrick, Co Down.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo crosses into West Yorkshire to begin the next leg of his journey, visiting the Worth Valley and the home of the three Bronte sisters, who were early investors in the railway industry. He then heads to Oakworth to find out how its station and tracks were used in one of the most popular films ever made, and in Bradford discovers the ways in which 19th-century workers saved to buy a home. The presenter finishes in Halifax, where he learns how the railways contributed to the town's success.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo tunes into the music of the mills and collieries of Victorian England by joining a brass band in Honley, West Yorkshire, before stopping off in Holmfirth to learn about a tragedy that led to a tourist boom in the town. The presenter then crosses into Derbyshire to pay homage to railway engineer George Stephenson at his resting place in Chesterfield, before concluding his journey at Chatsworth House, which was one of the first stately homes to welcome visitors by rail.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A now-silent site that played a pivotal role defending the USA through the 20th century. Plus, a crumbling Italian fortress and a ghostly Ukrainian mansion.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the rich history of Belfast's Victorian docks, learns about a 150-year-old spade-making tradition and takes a walk along coastal paths of Whitehead, Co Antrim.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Great British Railway Journeys Goes to Ireland
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ends his journey across the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland by walking across the Carrick-a-Rede rope bridge in Co Antrim. He then follows in the footsteps of the Victorians at Giant's Causeway, and explores the history of Londonderry.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The stories behind closed roads, including a route once used by the French Resistance and areas made impassable by crumbling hills and sand dunes.

programme.title: Great British Landmark Fixers
programme.desc: Salt water and iron don't mix and Southend Pier, built back in 1888, has seen better days. Now a team of specialists are working hard to prevent it falling into the sea.

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: The Scalextric team attempt to tap into the brand's glory years, the 1980s, and devise a plan to create a model of a classic supercar, the Lamborghini Countach.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the final leg of his journey across southern Scotland from west to east, beginning by paying homage to the birthplace of golf at St Andrews. In Dunfermline, he learns about the humble origins of a remarkable philanthropist who worked on the railroads before making his fortune in steel, and then crosses the Forth Bridge to end his trip in Edinburgh, where he treads the boards in an unconventional adaptation of a play by Oscar Wilde at the Festival Fringe.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.desc: A local boy goes missing, and Burnside is forced to turn to a convicted paedophile for help in finding him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Peggy visits the consultant for tests. It's Simon's first day back at the stall. DCI Mason asks questions about Saskia. Bianca hears about the christening party.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Matthew's afraid to talk to the Police. Jeff enlists Dot's help. Peggy plans the christening. Louise returns to the Square and instantly argues with Bianca.

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tragedy looms as Andrew is swept away while trying to save an injured man from a fast-flowing river, giving Sam the opportunity to become the hero of the hour. Meanwhile, Joanna faces up to the traumatic prospect of breaking devastating news to a teenage girl. Gary Mavers and Joseph Millson star.

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Siegfried investigates when an outbreak of dog poisoning sweeps through the district, while Tristan joins the local bellringers for a farewell drink. Rural drama, starring Robert Hardy and Peter Davison.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The death of Sharon and Tracey's Aunt Sylvie soon has them jetting off to Hollywood in search of their real father. Festive special of the comedy from 1993, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson, with guest appearances by George Hamilton, George Wendt and Richard Branson.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barrowclough uncover the stash in his and Godber's cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Seymour plans to put the magic back into Christmas - but ends up with Compo stuck on the roof. Festive instalment of the rural comedy from 1986, starring Michael Aldridge, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Investigative reporter Maddy Magellan enlists the help of Jonathan Creek, who works as a creative consultant to a stage magician, in a bid to discover who is responsible for a painter's death. First episode of the mystery series, starring Alan Davies, Caroline Quentin, Anthony Head, Sheila Gish and Colin Baker.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The ex-coppers find themselves under the microscope when a psychologist arrives to conduct a study into older men in the workplace - but she soon reveals a more personal reason for her visit. It turns out that five years ago her brother, a cycle courier, was the victim of a hit-and-run that left him unable to recall anything prior to the incident. Now he says he was targeted for the parcel he was carrying, which was stolen at the scene - or so he believes. Sally Phillips guest stars.

programme.title: Bad Girls
programme.desc: Joy is left reeling by the discovery that Stella is her daughter, but rather than try to make up for lost time she attempts to have the inmate transferred to another prison. Meanwhile, Pat hatches a plan to get rid of Natalie forever after she discovers that she used children to get drugs into the prison. Lou experiences a change of heart, asking Rowan Dunlop out on a date, and Donny and Janine take the opportunity to get a little closer.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A case in which a security guard had to confront a terrifying shadow person in an empty stadium. Plus, the fleet of UFOs spotted by a man in Utah.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Boys School with a Dark Past & More
programme.desc: Ghost hunters contact a dead employee from an abandoned youth centre who is accused of terrible crimes.

programme.title: Swamp People: Serpent Invasion
programme.desc: The hunters face a terrifying reality - the invasion is bigger than they anticipated. With their backs against the wall, Troy, Chase and Bill call upon trackers and thermal drones to get a leg up on the snakes.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: North v South
programme.desc: Charlie Griffin accuses Tyler McLaughlin of not playing by the rules, and Britton Shackelford takes a day off to attend a benefit for his daughter, but fears what it will cost him.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny builds a world-class bike for a high-end client, and if all goes well it could mean a ton of new business for the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: An important client has his heart set on a tricked out '68 Camaro, so Danny Koker sets out to find one and give it the world class Counts Kustoms treatment.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Shannon recruits the guys to help him finish up a gift for Danny, a bike he started building for him 10 years ago, and Koker spots a 1969 Corvette in a friend's lot.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: There are fierce negotiations for an American Civil War musket and Corey feels the brunt of his father's anger when he sells a rare poster from his movie collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer brings in a ticket to the Beatles' 1966 concert at New York's Shea Stadium, and the team plans a birthday surprise.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley and Les head off to a huge estate sale. Seth takes a custom Corvette go-kart for a spin and Karen eyes up a piece of 1970s movie memorabilia.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les gets invited to give a lecture at a local business school. Meanwhile, Ashley and Bobby J go to war over a collection of Nerf guns.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les questions Ashley's management skills when two employees get into a fight on the shop floor. Meanwhile, Seth stumbles upon a potentially huge deal.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les hatches a secret plan to put his employees to the test, but how will Seth, Ashley and Karen react when they find out.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick gets the chance to restore a Nasa jet pack signed by Buzz Aldrin and a client brings in a Second World War bomb.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Astronaut theorists examine the creation myth of the 'Cosmic Egg', and look at why the concept is so pervasive throughout the world.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The programme contemplates the possibility of the first astronauts reaching Mars in the next 20 years, and wonders if there is evidence to suggest human life was first seeded there.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell finds what could be a valuable antique gun - or possibly a worthless fake. Jarrod and Brandi get their hands on a collection of Depression-era art.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave wins a furniture unit, Darrell gets hold of some 1970s sound equipment, and Barry lays his hands on something truly vintage.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The guys bid for crates at a vault sale and Darrell prepares for a showdown with Dave.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod comes under pressure as his shop runs empty, while Barry tries to bring his losing streak to an end.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey and Chumlee are offered a Bugs Bunny poster signed by voice artist Mel Blanc, and also consider buying a golf club once owned by Dean Martin.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee shares his experience of running a successful pawn shop with Antwan, and the team values a rare Second World War artefact.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer offers the team a gambling set - complete with concealed weapons - while Chumlee questions the value of a Snoop Dogg doll.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee takes over from Antwaun as the shop's security guard, while the team values a drum from the American Civil War and a motorcycle club uniform.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: When Ashley interferes with one of Karen's sales on the shop floor, a family feud breaks out. Meanwhile, a rock metal group drops by.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les finally lands a buyer for his special edition Lee Iacocca Mustang, but loses his cool when he learns Seth sent the hot rod out on consignment.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part one of two. Karen comes up with a big idea for the shop, while Byron puts two ice hockey fans in their place when they get physical over a vintage puck.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Part two of two. The day of Karen's big event arrives, but Ashley gives Les an ultimatum that could change American Jewelry and Loan for ever.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists who suggest that aliens have been guiding mankind in secret to bring about huge leaps in technological advancement.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: As science turns towards augmenting humanity with technology, theorists suggest that society is merely following the path of its alien creators.

programme.title: Salvage Kings
programme.desc: Ted puts Brandon's sales skills to the test, pushing him to figure out his future with the team. Then, a trip to Shelburne leads to a difficult extraction.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Chester sort the treasures from their trash, offering them the chance to put items up for auction or accept a cash sum. A Welsh-speaking seller tries to charm the dealers, and a pair of chatty sisters pay two visits to the auction.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team visit Middlesbrough, where they haggle over items brought in by members of the public, including original Doctor Who artwork and an impressive collection of jewellery, which causes a major stir.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: The team stumbles upon the first signs that the swamp's stone roadway could be heading towards the Money Pit.

programme.title: Secrets in the Ice
programme.desc: Great mysteries that have been frozen in time, from the mummified remains of three Inca children in the Andes to members of the ancient Yupik people in Alaska.

programme.title: Monsterquest
programme.desc: Cryptozoologists use special equipment to try to shed light on reports of torpedolike creatures that fly so quickly they cannot be spotted by the naked eye.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic scientists continually re-evaluate unsolved crimes with new evidence and advanced methods of detection.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: How, after enjoying the trip of a lifetime, a 66-year-old man failed to return home to his wife. Detectives needed to rely on CCTV to uncover the facts of his disappearance.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The deaths of Alabama country store owner Billy Triplett and his wife Debbie in June 2001. Locals suspected their fate must have been connected with his illegal side-business of retailing alcohol. However, when word of a bloodstained stash of money reached investigators, they were shocked to realise the identity of the person wishing to conceal it.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: One year after the original crime, new clues emerge regarding the location of the suspects in an armed home invasion during which a police officer was shot.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Sadler discovers what she believes to be fighting cockerels in the back of a pick-up truck, and Lieutenant Scott faces a daring bridge rescue.

programme.title: Crikey! It's the Irwins
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Steve Irwin's family at Australia Zoo. After months of training with Steve's best friend Wes, son Robert is ready to solo feed Graham, the zoo's most notorious crocodile.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: The team has no time to make a dress from scratch, so a bride with a strong social media presence must settle for something off the rail.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride's friend hates every dress she sees, while another walks off the run way and refuses to be in the wedding wearing a strapless dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights with her mother-in-law about the length of dresses, and another gets into a dispute with her opinionated wedding planner.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.sub-title: No Dress, No Suit, No Venue, Oh My!
programme.desc: Kristen and Max have taken their chill lifestyle to the extreme. With only weeks until their wedding, there is no dress or venue in sight.

programme.title: My Cat from Hell
programme.desc: In a first for the show, Jackson Galaxy helps a cat that cannot get along in its rescue home to move in with a foster family, hoping they will eventually adopt the fussy feline.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator Marisa McHugh and Field Ops Manager Stacie DaBolt rescue a dog whose limbs have been bound together before being left to die in a skip.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.sub-title: Like a Dog in a Cage
programme.desc: A woman who wants to protect her children from their father's hoard, and an artist who chooses frogs, penguins and banana skins over her live-in boyfriend.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigating the case of a mother and daughter who went missing following a fire on their boat. A forensic analysis of the wreckage suggested the blaze was started deliberately.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An account of the homebuyer whose survey uncovered a mummified corpse. Plus, events following a sudden rise in the death rate at a hospital, when suspicion fell on its staff.

programme.title: Happily Never After
programme.desc: The death of 24-year-old preacher's daughter Christa, shot in her home in June 2008, three months after her marriage to youth pastor Couty Alexander. Her husband later admitted to the crime, claiming he had directed his gun to his pregnant wife without realising it was loaded.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 27-year-old Tracy Ocasio, who went missing from West Orlando, Florida, in May 2009. On the night of her disappearance she was seen in the company of a man currently serving a life sentence for the attempted murder of another woman. When one of her boots was found in woodland detectives searched the area, but no body was recovered.

programme.title: Who the (Bleep) Did I Marry?
programme.desc: The story of Andrea Merriman, whose husband of 20 years was involved in a financial scam, meaning the family stood to lose everything. Shawn Merriman, a lay bishop in the Mormon church, was head of an investment firm that persuaded friends, family, and church members to invest with him. It raked in more than $21million, and among the victims was his own mother.

programme.title: Who the (Bleep) Did I Marry?
programme.desc: The story of Jennifer Ranallo, whose husband Jack secretly ran several elaborate set-ups that conned families of several thousand dollars.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Chassidy is looking for her dream dress - the problem is, so is her scene-stealing mother. Can Mum put her own agenda aside long enough to give Chassidy her day?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Untraditional bride Maranda is looking for the perfect 'out-of-the-box' magical fairy-tale dress for when she meets her husband for the first time - at the wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Morticia Addams In A Good Way
programme.desc: Hayley Paige helps a bride wanting to look like a creepy fairy. Plus, a bride with a penchant for pickiness admits to already trying over 150 dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Angelica searches for the perfect strapless gown, but her mother, who is paying for the dress, has other ideas.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: On Boxing Day 1967, 17-year-old Sheila Thomas gave birth to a girl she named Jacqueline, but despite her initial hopes, plans were put in place for the baby to be adopted. Sheila, now 64, went on to have a happy marriage, but never had any more children in the belief she would be betraying the memory of her daughter. Stephen Andrews grew up feeling ashamed that his birth mother was unable to keep him. Now, at the age of 49, he's hoping for answers to questions that have plagued him throughout his adult life. Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell guide the pair through emotional reunions with their long-lost relatives.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. JT is almost 900lbs with a 100lb lymphedema mass on his leg and a dangerous food addiction. When his girlfriend takes him to Houston, his behaviour drives her away.

programme.title: TBA
programme.desc: Uncovering stories of people round the world who suffer from rare and mysterious medical conditions. Some require surgery so complex that the odds of survival are minimal at best..

programme.title: Nurses Who Kill
programme.desc: A chilling look at the nurses and carers who ended the lives of the patients they were meant to help, with insight from experts, doctors, and the victims' relatives..

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a determined FBI agent brought about the conviction of John Gotti, the homicidal head of the Gambino crime family in New York.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Police find threatening e-mails, an abandoned truck and an abundance of evidence at the crime scene - but no body. Series revealing how forensics are used to solve violent crimes.

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them. In this instalment, the bodies of three women are found floating in Tampa Bay, with any useful evidence washed away. However, police hope a handwritten note found in the victims' car will lead to the killer - so they post huge copies of the note on five highway billboards..

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators try to uncover the identity of the person responsible for killing four people, but find little evidence at the crime scene.

programme.title: Medical Detectives

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Documentary profiling real-life crimes and how investigators solve them. In this instalment, the bodies of three women are found floating in Tampa Bay, with any useful evidence washed away. However, police hope a handwritten note found in the victims' car will lead to the killer - so they post huge copies of the note on five highway billboards..

programme.title: Medical Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators try to uncover the identity of the person responsible for killing four people, but find little evidence at the crime scene.
